TopicTitle: FirstSecondThird's Good 'Ol Tutorials #1: Finding a good amount of mods

Articles.Content:
Good heavens! Did you overload your install with mods?!

Well if you did, lucky for you I have a tutorial on how to solve your RAM usage problems.

Step #1: Look up "Active Texture Management mod for KSP <Your install version number here>" on Google, without the quotes. (It should be a KSP Forums link, don't press any other links, if you do, I AM NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR BROKEN WINDOWS INSTALLS!)

Step #2: Download it and open the .zip file and you will see a 'GameData' folder, merge this folder with your GameData folder in your install folder. .e.g Steam/SteamApps/common/Kerbal Space Program.

Step #3: Run KSP.

And BAM! You got yourself a working KSP install, with a lot of mods!

Thanks for the applause! I will see you later kerbonauts!

Pecan's FirstSecondThird Tutorial #1: Where to post tutorials.

-> In the 'Tutorials' sub-forum, not "gameplay questions and tutorials"

Which is ironic, because a lot of people make the opposite mistake and put questions in the 'tutorial' section.

This is the link to Active Texture Management (in the 'Add-on Releases' forum)
